docTitle.titlePart:
Two-Dimensional Monovalent Copper Halide Coordination Polymers
Incorporating Anti-Conformation 3, 3-Bipyridine

byline.docAuthor:
Lindsey L. Johnston a , Andrew J. Ursini a , Nathan P. Oien a , Matthew P. Desciak b , Randy S. Rarig, Jr. c ,
Jon Zubieta c , and Robert L. LaDuca a, *

byline.affiliation: Michigan State University, Lyman Briggs College and Department of Chemistry
King's College, Department of Chemistry and Physics

front.div:
Abstract. Hydrothermal treatment of aqueous mixtures of cop-
per(II) halides and 3, 3-bipyridine (3, 3-bpy) has afforded the coor-
dination polymers [CuCl(3, 3-bpy)] n (1) and [Cu 2 Br 2 (3, 3-bpy)] n
(2), which were analyzed via single crystal X-ray diffraction, infra-
red spectroscopy, and elemental analysis. The structure of 1 consists
of two-dimensional (2-D) layers constructed from the linkage of
castellated one-dimensional (1-D) [CuCl] n stepped chains through
anti-conformation 3, 3-bpy tethers. Compound 2 presents a related
2-D sheet motif, albeit built from infinite 1-D [Cu 2 Br 2 ] n ladders
strutted by 3, 3-bpy ligands in anti conformation. In both cases
neighboring 2-D sheets stack into 3-D via weak CH···halogen
interactions.
